com.fluidops.iwb.api
Interface NamespaceService

All Known Implementing Classes:
NamespaceServiceImpl
public interface NamespaceService

Namespace functionality that is not exposed outside, i.e. accessable only internally.

Author:
aeb, msc

getAbbreviatedURI

java.lang.String getAbbreviatedURI(org.openrdf.model.URI uri)
We implement a special logic to see whether the URI *startsWith* the namespace (instead of checking for equality). This allows to also map e.g. http://www.fluidops.com/foo/bar to /ns/foo/bar (assuming http://www.fluidops.com/ being the namespace in question).

Parameters:
uri - The URI we want to represent as short name
Returns:
The short name

getAbbreviatedURIs

java.util.List<java.lang.String> getAbbreviatedURIs(org.openrdf.model.URI uri)
Gets all abbreviated URIs known for the uri. For instance, for we return [rdfs:comment,comment].

Parameters:
uri - The URI we want to represent as short name
Returns:
list of short names (may be empty)

getNamespace

java.lang.String getNamespace(org.openrdf.model.URI uri)
Returns the (largest mapping) namespace from the list of loaded namespaces. If the namespace is not matched, null is returned.

Parameters:
uri -
Returns:

getFullURI

guessURI

org.openrdf.model.URI guessURI(java.lang.String name)
Tries to resolve a prefixed URI using namespace information. May return null if string cannot be treated as URI. If the string is enclosed in "<" and ">" signs, the inner string will be treated as URI.

guessURIOrCreateInDefaultNS

org.openrdf.model.URI guessURIOrCreateInDefaultNS(java.lang.String name)
Tries to resolve a prefixed URI using namespace information. If the string is enclosed in "<" and ">" signs, the inner string will be treated as URI. Replaces all illegal URI characters by an underscore. Does never return null, but note that different strings may be mapped to the same URI, e.g. "Person{A" and "Person}A" will both be mapped to URI "Person_A". In the (very unlikely) case that something goes wrong, a RuntimeException is thrown.

createURIInDefaultNS

org.openrdf.model.URI createURIInDefaultNS(java.lang.String name)
Creates a URI for the string in the default namespaces. Replaces all illegal URI characters by an underscore. Does never return null, but note that different strings may be mapped to the same URI, e.g. "Person{A" and "Person}A" will both be mapped to URI "Person_A". In the (very unlikely) case that something goes wrong, a RuntimeException is thrown.

guessValue

org.openrdf.model.Value guessValue(java.lang.String valueStr)
Tries to resolve a prefixed URI or a value given as a string using namespace information

parseValue

org.openrdf.model.Value parseValue(java.lang.String s)
Parses a value according to (a slightly simplified) version of the SPARQL GraphTerm specification (cf. W3C SPARQL Grammar "[45] Graph Term"). Namespaces are resolved (and if resolving fails, an error is thrown). In contrast to the W3C, we do not support blank nodes and no NIL; further the "double" datatype (with exponent notation) is not and we assume there is no escaping in literals. If we need better standard compliance at some time, it would probably be best to integrate the W3C EBNF grammar and use an existing EBNF parser, but for now this is good enough.

Returns:
null if parsing failed, the value otherwise

parseURI

org.openrdf.model.URI parseURI(java.lang.String s)
Parses a full URI or a prefixed URI, dependent on the first non-whitespace character.

Parameters:
s -

Returns:

parseStringLiteral

org.openrdf.model.Literal parseStringLiteral(java.lang.String s)
Parses a string literal like "test", "test"@de", or "test"^^xsd:string.

Parameters:
s - the string to parse
Returns:

matchStandardURI

org.openrdf.model.URI matchStandardURI(java.lang.String string)
Tries to match the string against existing standard vocabulary. Returns the URI of the matched vocabulary in case of success, false otherwise.

Parameters:
string -
Returns:
